description: From Middle English unclothen, equivalent to un- +â€Ž clothe.

verbs.description: unclothe (third-person singular simple present unclothes, present participle unclothing, simple past and past participle unclothed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To strip of clothes or covering; to make naked.
examples: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.
